{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine whether tumor depth should be included in prognostication of soft tissue sarcoma, we need to consider the relevance of tumor depth in predicting the outcome of the disease. Tumor depth refers to the extent of invasion of the tumor into the surrounding tissues. It is an important factor in determining the stage and prognosis of soft tissue sarcoma. Tumors that invade deeper into the surrounding tissues are generally associated with a higher risk of recurrence and metastasis. Therefore, including tumor depth in prognostication can provide valuable information about the aggressiveness of the tumor and help guide treatment decisions. Based on this information, the answer is A. yes.", "answer_choice": "A"}
